channel.title: gluon gun kills
channel.description: it is obvious that the gluon gun from half life uses a beam of raw energy, so what about when you kill something with the gluon gun they would die the same way as if you'd killed them with an energy pellet from hl2, you know dissintegrate in a sort off... static-y way

item.dc:creator: UrBY

I read the first couple of lines. The author is trying to hard and as a result its almost a strain to read. Some things are best left to the imagination of the reader, and this amount of over-description doesn’t allow the reader to think of anything.

item.title: gluon gun kills
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
I just discovered a new way the gluon gun might work:

Two electricity aliens stood over a dead scientist, conversing in a fluxing voice over the body like it was a water cooler. Gordon pushed the red button. The backpack made a noise like five vacuum cleaners working at the same time, and the hose ejected a spiralling shaft of blue light towards his enemies. One touch from the blast turned the right-hand one to a yellow cloud, evaporating it on the spot.

It’s from here, I recommend it if you haven’t read it yet.

Read full topic

item.title: gluon gun kills
item.dc:creator: Atomic_Waffle
item.description:
In my opinion the Gluon Gun, being the most powerful weapon one can acquire in the game, should be extremely visually impressive as far as destroying enemies is concerned. Gibbing is done with all of the other weapons and thus I think that some sort of blue disintegration effect is in order, with an appearance similar to an electrical discharge. However, one thing that bothered me about the original gluon was that it simply exploded the enemies in place. If it were a beam of energy that powerful, the disintegrated bits of enemies would have to be blown AWAY from the player, as opposed to every conceivable direction at once.

As far as the actual effect, it should be similar to the gibbing, but the gibs should be smaller, charred pieces of enemies with small temporary blue particle trails on them. A satisfying piff of blood upon contact with enemies would also be increasingly satisfying as well.

The beam, in my opinion, should be more or less the same; I think that the center beam should be more intense and opaque, bluish white, and the surrounding helix should have a similar look to an arc of electricity. At least, that’s how I see it.

Read full topic

item.title: gluon gun kills
item.dc:creator: Alcator
item.description:
(rot)(fodder:

I would much rather shoot some fool, have him rip apart and watch his liver splat on a wall ten feet behind him than have him fizzle and float away.

I’m really sorry that your masturbation fantasy remained unfullfilled. Some players consider half-life to be “intelligent” FPS, and while the gore does help to ground the game a bit in reality (such as you see blood stains on walls behind you after being shot at), we’re not playing the game to score gorekills (that’s what Unreal Tournaments “Frag Monkey” and “Head Shot” awards are for).

For players like me, the disintegration was very rewarding, especially when I manage to disintegrate several enemies with a single shot.

A pro tip: Try that sometimes.

Read full topic
